document_data.name: Into the Feywild
document_data.author: [[Gyldro Angleiron]]
document_data.mainbody:
'''''Into the Feywild''''' was an unpublished memoir by [[Gyldro Angleiron]] from sometime in or before the 15{{th}} century [[DR]].

{{quote|''I called my name out into the darkness, and nothing came back. Not even an echo. That was the moment I knew I was truly alone, and that I - Gyldro Angleiron - would have to find a way to confront myself, accept myself, and fundamentally embrace myself for exactly who I was. And it was the Feywild that would teach me how...''|Excerpt from ''Into the Feywild''}}
document_data.History: A copy of this unpublished memoir could be found in Gyldro Angleiron's home, adjacent to his smithy and shop, the [[The Rivington General]] in the [[Baldur's Gate/Rivington|Rivington]] district of [[Baldur's Gate]] in the {{YearlinkName|1492}}.
